meaning: to take somebody else’s child into your family and become its legal parent(s) / to formally accept a suggestion or policy by voting
example: The police adopted tighter security measures. / She was forced to have her baby adopted.

meaning: events that are of public interest or political importance / a sexual relationship between two people, usually when one or both of them are already in a relationship with somebody else / an object that is unusual or difficult to describe
example: world/international affairs / It's the story of a secret affair between a married teacher and her teenage student

meaning: the land along the edge of the sea, the ocean or a lake

meaning: showing what you really think or feel

meaning: available to do what you want with rather than work/ not used/needed

meaning: very impressive

meaning: to flow over the edge of a container by accident; to make liquid do this

meaning: a feeling of wanting to hurt or upset somebody

meaning: fixed or steady; not likely to move, change or fai

meaning: a table or small shop with an open front that people sell things from, especially at a market

meaning: difficult to bend/move OR / not friendly

meaning: an area where people live that is outside the centre of a city

meaning: enough for a particular purpose; as much as you need

meaning: to officially stop something or somebody for a time/to hang something from something else

meaning: to clean a room/push something with a lot of force
example: to sweep the floor/ the little boat was swept out to sea

meaning: to make a determined effort to deal with a difficult problem or situation

meaning: a story

meaning: a situation in which people do not trust each other, or feel unfriendly

meaning: done completely; with great attention to detail
example: a thorough knowledge of the subject

meaning: a piece of soft paper, used especially as a handkerchief
example: a box of tissues

meaning: to find or discover somebody/something by looking carefully for them/it  OR / gentally touch
example: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago /She lightly traced the outline of his face with her finger

meaning: a particular quality in your personality
example: Arrogance is a very unattractive personality/character trait.

meaning: to decide if somebody accused of a crime is guilty or not / the process of testing the ability, quality / competitions
example: on trial He's on trial for murder./ She agreed to employ me for a trial period./Olympic trials

meaning: a group or class of people, especially of one profession
example: He had a sudden outburst against the whole tribe of actors

meaning: a series of musical notes that are sung or played in a particular order to form a piece of music
example: I can play a few tunes on the piano.

meaning: happening at the end of a long process/most extreme; best, worst, greatest, most important, etc.
example: We will accept ultimate responsibility for whatever happens./This race will be the ultimate test of your skill

meaning: to experience something, especially a change or something unpleasant
example: Some children undergo (complete transformation when they become teenagers.)

meaning: to make yourself responsible for something and start doing it
example: to undertake a task/project

meaning: to become open and flat
example: to unfold a map

meaning: to advise or try hard to persuade somebody to do something
example: urge somebody to do something If you ever get the chance to visit this place, I strongly urge you to do so.

meaning: to be different from each other in size, shape, etc.
example: New techniques were introduced with varying degrees of success.

meaning: the place where a public event or meeting happens:
example: The hotel is an ideal venue for conferences and business meetings.

meaning: a regular amount of money that you earn, usually every week or every month, for work or services
example: a weekly wage of £300

meaning: to walk slowly around or to a place, often without any particular sense of purpose or direction
example: We wandered back towards the car.

meaning: a large amount of money, property, etc. that a person or country owns
example: the desire to gain wealth and power

meaning: the general health, happiness and safety of a person, an animal or a group
example: We are concerned about the child's welfare.

meaning: a plant whose yellowish-brown grain is used for making flour, or the grain itself:
example: wheat flour

example: a bullet/knife/shrapnel wound

meaning: the joint between the hand and the arm

meaning: to end an activity or custom officially:
example: I think bullfighting should be abolished.

meaning: the killing of a large number of people especially in a cruel way
example: the bloody massacre of innocent civilians

meaning: legally responsible for paying the cost of something / likely to do something

meaning: to succeed in getting something, usually after a lot of effort

meaning: part of a film showing a particular event

meaning: making you feel anxious and upset or shocked

meaning: expressed as though something is a fact but without giving any proof

meaning: that makes you pay attention to it because it is so interesting and exciting

meaning: a comfortable or suitable role, job, way of life, etc

meaning: to completely destroy a place or an area

meaning: to show or introduce a new plan, product, etc. to the public for the first time

meaning: the top part of your legs that forms a flat surface when you are sitting down
example: you'll have to sit on my lap.

meaning: mix / to move, or to make something move, slightly / to make somebody excited or make them feel something strongly
example: She stirred her tea. / She heard the baby stir in the next room. / It's a book that really stirs the imagination

meaning: the act of keeping something in its original state or in good condition
example: building/environmental/food preservation

meaning: a husband or wife

meaning: a service provided for the public, for example an electricity, water or gas supply

meaning: a group of lines that form a unit in a poem or song

meaning: a business project or activity, especially one that involves taking risks

meaning: a person or company that has a contract to do work or provide goods or services for another company
example: a building/roofing/electrical contractor

meaning: c1[transitive, intransitive]to make cloth, a carpet, a basket, etc. by crossing threads or narrow pieces of material across, over and under each other by hand or on a machine called a loom
example: Most spiders weave webs that are almost invisible.

meaning: an act of saying or showing that you will not do, give or accept something

meaning: to get involved in and try to influence a situation that should not really involve you, in a way that annoys other people

meaning: c1lasting for a long time; difficult to cure

meaning: to give a religious talk in a public place, especially in a church during a service

meaning: the decision to start using something such as an idea, a plan or a name

meaning: a small area of still water, especially one that is artificial

meaning: an amount of money that you pay regularly to receive a service, be a member of a club, support a charity or receive regular copies of a newspaper or magazine; the act of paying this money
example: an annual subscription

meaning: that you would like to have or do; worth having or doing

meaning: a serious emotional request, especially for something needing action now

meaning: connected with a parent or parents
example: parental responsibility/rights

meaning: a trip that you go on for pleasure or education, usually with a group of people and lasting no more than one day

meaning: a separate section of a train for carrying passengers
example: a railway carriage

meaning: an action or a piece of work that needs skill, strength or courage

meaning: at the back of something:

meaning: a complete and careful investigation of something

meaning: according to a rule or the way that somebody says that something should be done
example: in accordance with legal requirements

meaning: a group or collection of people, animals or things

meaning: to fail to see or notice something/to see something wrong or bad but decide to ignore it/if a building, etc. overlooks a place, you can see that place from the building
example: He seems to have overlooked one important fact./We could not afford to overlook such a serious offence./a restaurant overlooking the lake

meaning: a large deep hole in the ground

meaning: showing you do not think that you are as important as other people

meaning: to tell somebody to take a particular medicine or have a particular treatment; to write a prescription for a particular medicine, etc.

meaning: the murder of a large number of people from a particular nation or ethnic group, with the aim of destroying that nation or group

meaning: a gun with a long barrel which you hold to your shoulder to fire

meaning: either of the two organs in the body that remove waste products from the blood and produce urine

meaning: intended to last for only a short time until somebody/something more permanent is found

meaning: to leave a person or place very quickly, especially because you are afraid of possible danger

meaning: the ability or qualities necessary to do something

meaning: a level of quality that can be used as a standard when comparing other things:
example: Tests at the age of seven provide a benchmark against which the child's progress at school can be measured.

meaning: a person who is the next most important person below a business manager, a head of a school, a political leader, etc. and who does that person’s job when they are away

meaning: to calculate something

meaning: a person who pays rent for the use of a room, building, land, etc. to the person who owns it

meaning: a building where large quantities of goods are stored, especially before they are sent to shops to be sold
example: Police are investigating a fire at a furniture warehouse.

meaning: a person who acts as a judge in a law court that deals with crimes that are less serious:
example: He will appear before the magistrates tomorrow.

meaning: officially connected with a town or city/
example: civic buildings/leaders

meaning: complete and not damaged

meaning: the act of getting involved in and trying to influence a situation that should not really involve you, in a way that annoys other people
example: They resent foreign interference in the internal affairs of their country.

meaning: in or connected with a suburb
example: suburban areas

meaning: following immediately one after the other
example: This was their fourth successive win.

meaning: the process of gradually increasing or getting more and more of something over a period of time
example: the accumulation of wealth

meaning: the act of carefully watching a person suspected of a crime or a place where a crime may be committed

meaning: behaviour or attitudes that show high moral standards
example: He led a life of virtue.

meaning: connected with the sea and the creatures and plants that live there
example: marine life

meaning: a group of people who are not professional soldiers but who have had military training and can act as an army
example: He said he would call out the state militia if the rebels did not surrender.

meaning: the act of getting rid of something

meaning: a group of people who are elected to govern an area such as a city or county

meaning: the practice of obeying rules or requests made by people in authority

meaning: a lawyer who prepares legal documents, for example for the sale of land or buildings, advises people on legal matters, and can speak for them in some courts of law

meaning: c1a person who buys and sells goods in large quantities, especially one who imports and exports goods

meaning: respected and admired as very important or of very high quality
example: a highly prestigious university

meaning: a heavy metal object that is attached to a rope or chain and dropped over the side of a ship or boat to keep it in one place/a person or thing that gives somebody a feeling of safety
example: We raised the anchor and set sail. /the anchor of the family

meaning: (literary)not often
example: Now that we have a baby, we seldom get the chance to go to the cinema.

meaning: to choose somebody for a job or position of responsibility
example: appoint somebody They have appointed a new head teacher at my son's school.

meaning: c1portray somebody/somethingto show somebody/something in a picture; to describe somebody/something in a piece of writing
example: The painting portrays the duke’s third wife.

meaning: to recognize or show that two things are not the same
example: differentiate (between) A and B It's difficult to differentiate between the two varieties.

meaning: to smile widely
example: They grinned with delight when they heard our news.

meaning: to make objects, patterns, etc. by cutting away material from a piece of wood or stone, or another hard material
example: He carved her name on a tree.

meaning: to take place at the same time
example: It's a pity our trips to New York don't coincide.

meaning: to put something quickly into a liquid and take it out again / to go downwards or to a lower level; to make something do this
example: dip something (into something) He dipped the brush into the paint. / The sun dipped below the horizon.

meaning: a statement or an idea that forms the basis for a reasonable line of argument
example: the basic premise of her argument

meaning: the act of annoying or worrying somebody by putting pressure on them or saying or doing unpleasant things to them
example: workplace/street harassment (= that happens at work/in the street)

meaning: an organization, a large institution or a hotel / the people in a society or a profession who have influence and power and who usually do not support change / the act of starting or creating something that is meant to last for a long time
example: The speaker announced the establishment of a new college.

meaning: a small amount of something that remains at the end of a process
example: pesticide residues in fruit and vegetables

meaning: an area of activity, interest or knowledge
example: in the realm of something in the realm of literature

meaning: a department or group of related departments in a college or university / all the teachers in a faculty of a college or university
example: the Faculty of Law

meaning: used in or connected with surgery
example: surgical procedures

meaning: the place where two or more roads or railway lines meet
example: It was near the junction of City Road and Old Street.

meaning: the practice of showing respect for God or a god, by saying prayers, singing with others, etc.; a ceremony for this / a strong feeling of love and respect for somebody/something
example: an act/a place of worship / What she feels for him is akin to worship.

meaning:
the quality of being based on truth or reason, or of being able to be accepted: / 
the fact of having legal force, or being legally acceptable:
example: This research seems to give/lend some validity to the theory that the drug might cause cancer. /A computer system will check the validity of the insurance details of the person taxing the car.

meaning: to make it difficult for something to continue in the normal way /
example: Demonstrators succeeded in disrupting the meeting.

meaning: to say that something is true, especially in an argument / to compete against somebody in order to gain something
example: I would contend that the minister's thinking is flawed on this point. / Three armed groups were contending for power.

meaning: the situation when a factory, school, hospital, etc. shuts permanently/
example: The hospital has been threatened with closure.

meaning: large in amount, value or importance
example: substantial sums of money

meaning: to say officially that somebody/something has a particular character or name; to describe somebody/something in a particular way
example: be designated (as) something This area has been designated (as) a National Park.

meaning: to make somebody/something change direction / c1[often passive]to use money, materials, etc. for a different purpose from their original purpose / to take somebody’s thoughts or attention away from something
example: be diverted The course of the stream has now been diverted. /  be diverted (from something) (to/into something) More of the budget was diverted into promotions. / The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.

meaning: making people have a good opinion of somebody/something
example: She made a favourable impression on his parents.

meaning: without an end; existing or continuing forever
example: the promise of eternal life in heaven

meaning: violent and cruel
example: a vicious attack

meaning: money that somebody agrees to pay if a person accused of a crime does not appear at their trial. When bail has been arranged, the accused person is allowed to go free until the trial.
example: She was released on £2 000 bail.

meaning: a cruel and violent act, especially in a war
example: In the war, both sides committed atrocities.

meaning: the country where a person was born
example: Many refugees have been forced to flee their homeland.

meaning: to keep somebody/something inside the limits of a particular activity, subject, area, etc.
example: The work will not be confined to the Glasgow area.

meaning: a lack of agreement between facts, opinions, actions, etc.
example: There is a contradiction between the two sets of figures.

meaning: extremely large or great
example: There is still an immense amount of work to be done.

meaning: a member of a commission (= an official group of people who are responsible for controlling something or finding out about something)
example: the Church Commissioners (= the group of people responsible for controlling the financial affairs of the Church of England)

meaning: the freedom or power to decide what should be done in a particular situation / keep something in secret
example: I'll leave it up to you to use your discretion. / This is confidential, but I know that I can rely on your discretion.

meaning: to make something seem larger, better, worse or more important than it really is
example: The hotel was really filthy and I'm not exaggerating.

meaning: to break something suddenly with a sharp noise; to be broken in this way / to take a photograph
example: The wind had snapped the tree in two. /  A passing tourist snapped the incident.

meaning: by which; because of which
example: They have introduced a new system whereby all employees must undergo regular training.

meaning: to bring a feeling, a memory or an image into your mind
example: The music evoked memories of her youth.

meaning: a person who is captured and held prisoner by a person or group, and who may be injured or killed if people do not do what the person or group is asking
example: Three children were taken hostage during the bank robbery.

meaning: if you resume an activity, or if it resumes, it begins again or continues after being interrupted
example: She resumed her career after an interval of six years.

meaning: a feeling of great worry or unhappiness; great mental pain
example: The newspaper article caused the actor considerable distress.

meaning: action taken to improve or help a situation
example: calls for government intervention to save the steel industry

meaning: temporarily not speaking or refusing to speak
example: We were all struck dumb with amazement.

meaning: a fact that people are made aware of, especially one that has been secret and is surprising
example: The company's financial problems followed the revelation of a major fraud scandal.

meaning: something that happens or exists
example: Vandalism used to be a rare occurrence here.

meaning: to state clearly and definitely that something is true
example: The report asserts confidently that the industry will grow.

meaning: determined to do something despite difficulties, especially when other people are against you and think that you are being annoying or unreasonable
example: She can be very persistent when she wants something.

meaning: shared by, including or typical of a whole group of things; not specific
example: Vine fruit’ is the generic term for currants and raisins.

meaning: the activity of playing games of chance for money and of betting on horses, etc.
example: The police are trying to stop all illegal gambling.

meaning: the quality of being dense; the degree to which something is dense
example: The population density in this city is very high.

meaning: located between two places, things, states, etc. / having more than a basic knowledge of something but not yet advanced; suitable for somebody who is at this level
example: intermediate between A and B Liquid crystals are considered to be intermediate between liquid and solid.

meaning: something that exists separately from other things and has its own identity
example: The unit has become part of a larger department and no longer exists as a separate entity.

meaning: to become, and continue to be, successful, strong, healthy, etc.
example: New businesses thrive in this area.

meaning: a person or team with a chance of winning a competition
example: contender (for something) a contender for a gold medal in the Olympics

meaning: to build something
example: The church was erected in 1582.

meaning: shelter or protection from danger, trouble, etc.
example: A further 300 people have taken refuge in the US embassy.

meaning: a number of people or things that follow each other in time or order
example: a succession of visitors

meaning: to make a claim against a person or an organization in court about something that they have said or done to harm you
example: They threatened to sue if the work was not completed.

meaning: to hold or fix something more securely in position; to make something or become more difficult to move, open or separate
example: tighten something to tighten a lid/screw/rope/knot

meaning: hesitating before doing something because you do not want to do it or because you are not sure that it is the right thing to do
example: He finally gave a reluctant smile.

meaning: to become smaller, weaker, etc.; to make something become smaller, weaker, etc. / to make somebody/something seem less important than they really are
example: The world's resources are rapidly diminishing. / The trial has aged and diminished him.

meaning: great physical or mental pain / very poor living conditions
example: Fame brought her nothing but misery. / The vast majority of the population lives in utter misery

meaning: a thing that makes a situation more complicated or difficult
example: The bad weather added a further complication to our journey

meaning: the process of questioning people who are representative of a larger group in order to get information about the general opinion
example: to carry out/conduct a poll

meaning: easily damaged or broken / light and pleasant; not strong /showing or needing careful or sensitive treatment / made or formed in a very careful and detailed way
example: delicate china teacups / a river scene painted in delicate watercolours / a delicate problem / the delicate mechanisms of a clock

meaning: the total amount of crops, profits, etc. that are produced
example: a high crop yield

meaning: a good reason why something exists or is done
example: I can see no possible justification for any further tax increases.

meaning: to mix with a liquid and become part of it
example: Salt dissolves in water.

meaning: the main long, thin part of a plant above the ground from which the leaves or flowers grow; a smaller part that grows from this and supports flowers or leaves
example: long, trailing stems of ivy

meaning: the act of joining two or more organizations or businesses into one
example: If the merger goes through, thousands of jobs will be lost

meaning: having a quality or characteristic that makes something different and easily noticed
example: clothes with a distinctive style

meaning: a strong feeling of sympathy for people or animals who are suffering and a desire to help them
example: to feel/show compassion

meaning: to strongly criticize somebody/something that you think is wrong, illegal, etc.
example: denounce somebody/something She publicly denounced the government's handling of the crisis.

meaning: the state of being successful, especially in making money
example: Our future prosperity depends on economic growth.

meaning: full of life and energy, very bright and strong
example: a vibrant city / The room was decorated in vibrant reds and yellows.

meaning: causing destruction or damage
example: The war demonstrated the destructive power of modern weapons

meaning: if the value, amount or level of something soars, it rises very quickly
example: Air pollution will soon soar above safety levels

meaning: to throw something lightly or carelessly
example: I tossed the book aside and got up.

meaning: the authority that an official organization has to make legal decisions about somebody/something
example: The English court had no jurisdiction over the defendants.

meaning: a thing or person that reduces a shock or protects somebody/something against difficulties
example: Support from family and friends acts as a buffer against stress.

meaning: an event, a discovery, an invention, etc. that marks an important stage in something
example: The ceasefire was seen as a major landmark in the fight against terrorism.

meaning: the feeling that somebody/something is without value and deserves no respect at all
example: with contempt She looked at him with contempt.

meaning: an attempt to do something, especially something new or difficult
example: There have been great advances in the field of scientific endeavour.
